short_description: Buys the specified asset.
long_description:
When called, Harvests places a limit order with a limit
price 5% higher than the current price.

params.name: symbol
params.desc: Symbol of the asset to buy.

params.name: in_force
params.desc: Duration the order is in force. '{gtc}' or '{gtd}'.

params.name: extended
params.desc: Whether to trade in extended hours or not.

returns:
The following Python dictionary
- type: str, 'STOCK' or 'CRYPTO'
- id: str, ID of order
- symbol: str, symbol of asset

raises.desc: There is an error in the order process.

short_description: Buys the specified option.

params.name: symbol
params.desc: Symbol of the asset to buy, in {OCC} format

params.name: in_force
params.desc: Duration the order is in force. '{gtc}' or '{gtd}'.

returns:
A dictionary with the following keys:
- type: 'OPTION'
- id: ID of order
- symbol: symbol of asset

raises.desc: There is an error in the order process.

short_description: Sells the specified asset.

params.name: symbol
params.desc: Symbol of the asset to sell.

params.name: in_force
params.desc: Duration the order is in force. '{gtc}' or '{gtd}'.

params.name: extended
params.desc: Whether to trade in extended hours or not.

returns:
A dictionary with the following keys:
- type: str, 'STOCK' or 'CRYPTO'
- id: str, ID of order
- symbol: str, symbol of asset

raises.desc: There is an error in the order process.

short_description: Sells the specified option.

params.name: symbol
params.desc: Symbol of the asset to sell, in {OCC} format

params.name: in_force
params.desc: Duration the order is in force. '{gtc}' or '{gtd}'.

returns:
A dictionary with the following keys:
- type: 'OPTION'
- id: ID of order
- symbol: symbol of asset

raises.desc: There is an error in the order process.

short_description: Buys the specified asset, and hangs the code until the order is filled.

params.name: symbol
params.desc: Symbol of the asset to buy.

params.name: in_force
params.desc: Duration the order is in force. '{gtc}' or '{gtd}'.

params.name: extended
params.desc: Whether to trade in extended hours or not.

returns:
A dictionary with the following keys:
- type: 'STOCK' or 'CRYPTO'
- id: ID of order
- symbol: symbol of asset

raises.desc: There is an error in the order process.

short_description: Sells the specified asset, and hangs the code until the order is filled.

params.name: symbol
params.desc: Symbol of the asset to sell.

params.name: in_force
params.desc: Duration the order is in force. '{gtc}' or '{gtd}'.

params.name: extended
params.desc: Whether to trade in extended hours or not.

returns:
A dictionary with the following keys:
- type: 'STOCK' or 'CRYPTO'
- id: ID of order
- symbol: symbol of asset

raises.desc: There is an error in the order process.

short_description: Retrieves data of specified option.
returns:
A dictionary:
- price: price of option 
- ask: ask price
- bid: bid price

short_description: Returns the option chain for the specified symbol.
returns:
A dataframe with the follwing columns:
    - exp_date(datetime.datetime): The expiration date
    - strike(float): Strike price
    - type(str): 'call' or 'put'
    - id(str): The unique ID of the option  

The index is the {OCC} symbol of the option.

short_description: Returns metadata about a stock's option chain
returns:
A dict with the following keys:
- id: ID of the option chain 
- exp_dates: List of expiration dates, in the fomrat "YYYY-MM-DD" 
- multiplier: Multiplier of the option, usually 100

function: ema(self, symbol, period, interval, ref, prices)
short_description: Calculate EMA

params.name: prices
params.desc:
When specified, this function will use the values provided in the 
list to perform calculations and ignore other parameters.

returns: A list in numpy format, containing EMA values

function: rsi(self, symbol, period, interval, ref, prices)
short_description: Calculate RSI

params.name: prices
params.desc:
When specified, this function will use the values provided in the 
list to perform calculations and ignore other parameters.

returns: A list in numpy format, containing RSI values

function: sma(self, symbol, period, interval, ref, prices)
short_description: Calculate SMA

params.name: prices
params.desc:
When specified, this function will use the values provided in the 
list to perform calculations and ignore other parameters.

returns: A list in numpy format, containing SMA values

function: bbands(self, symbol, period, interval, ref, dev, prices)
short_description: Calculate Bollinger Bands

params.name: prices
params.desc:
When specified, this function will use the values provided in the 
list to perform calculations and ignore other parameters.

returns: A tuple of numpy lists, each a list of BBand top, average, and bottom values

short_description: Returns the current buying power of the user
returns: The current buying power as a float.

short_description: Returns the current equity.
returns: The current equity as a float.

short_description: Returns the most recent candle as a pandas DataFrame
long_description: This function is not compatible with options.

params.name: symbol
params.desc: Symbol of stock or crypto asset.

returns:
Price of asset as a dataframe with the following columns:
    - open
    - high
    - low
    - close
    - volume

The index is a datetime object

raises.desc: If symbol is not in the watchlist.

short_description: Returns the candles of an asset as a pandas DataFrame
long_description: This function is not compatible with options.

params.name: symbol
params.desc: Symbol of stock or crypto asset.

returns:
Prices of asset as a dataframe with the following columns:
    - open
    - high
    - low
    - close
    - volume

The index is a datetime object

raises.desc: If symbol is not in the watchlist.

short_description: Returns the average cost of a specified asset.
returns: Average cost of asset. Returns None if asset is not being tracked.

raises.desc: If symbol is not currently owned.

short_description: Returns the current date.
returns: The current date as a datetime object

short_description: Returns the current date and time.
long_description:
This returns the current time, which is different from the timestamp
on a ticker. For example, if you are running an algorithm every 5 minutes,
at 11:30am you will get a ticker for 11:25am. This function will return 
11:30am.
returns: The current date and time as a datetime object

short_description: Returns the current price of a specified asset.
returns: Price of asset.

raises.desc: If symbol is not in the watchlist.

short_description: Returns a list of recent prices for an asset.
long_description: This function is not compatible with options.

params.name: symbol
params.desc: Symbol of stock or crypto asset.

returns: List of prices

short_description: Returns the quantity owned of a specified asset.
returns: Quantity of asset.

raises.desc: If symbol is not currently owned.

short_description: Returns the return of a specified asset.

params.name: symbol
params.desc: Symbol of stock, crypto, or option. Options should be in {OCC} format.

returns: Return of asset, expressed as a decimal.

short_description: Returns the current hour and minute.
long_description:
This returns the current time, which is different from the timestamp
on a ticker. For example, if you are running an algorithm every 5 minutes,
at 11:30am you will get a ticker for 11:25am. This function will return 
11:30am.
returns: The current time as a datetime object
